# Burmese–Siamese wars__disambig_1

The Burmese–Siamese wars also known as the Yodian wars (), were a series of wars fought between Burma and Siam from the 16th to 19th centuries.

| style="vertical-align: top;"| Burmese defensive victory
| Second Siamese invasion of Burma Siam briefly captures the upper Tenasserim coast to Martaban in 1662 before driven back. In 1663, Siam again invades upper Tenasserim coast and Lan Na, capturing Chiang Mai. Siamese forces evacuate Chiang Mai in 1664.

| Siamese control of Lan NaLan Na declares independence in 1775, with a resurgent Siam's assistance (under King Taksin). Burma invades Lan Na and Siam. | Siamese invasion of Kengtung and Chiang Hung' Siam tries to take over Kengtung and Chiang Hung during the Second Anglo-Burmese War. Local Shan sawbwas'' hold out until Burma's main armies manage to drive out the Siamese in 1855.
